page.title: 01TEME VALLEY - WEST WORCS
page.content: The river Teme flows West to East across the Southern half of the area through a fertile valley about 1km wide, bounded on each side by higher ground. Hops have long been grown in the valley, and most farms have their distinctive block of kilns for drying the crop. Competition from European hop imports since joining the EEC, and a disease of the vines (hop wilt) have tended to reduce the dependence on hop-growing, but substantial hopyards remain. The South-facing slope of the valley wall, once mainly orchard, is now more commonly grazed by sheep. On the plateau are two villages of Frith Common and Menithwood, now occupied in the main by commuters. A generally wealthy area of high scenic beauty at all times of the year.
